body_html: No, there's no workaround. Once a device-side assert is triggered the whole CUDA context is put into an incorrect state, and we don't plan to add support for resetting the device (it invalidates all pointers, so you could get other weird errors if you had any CUDA tensors alive when you did that). Restarting the process seems to be the cleanest solution 😕
